poem:
**Customs Dance**

In the hall of governance,  
a letter flutters—  
Ed's pen in flight,  
urging the crimson wave  
to mold—reach, stretch, grasp  
the hands across the channel's breeze.

Union in motion,  
the promise of gold:  
whispers of growth,  
– in the thin morning light –  
a dance of papers,  
under a parliament sky.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Lib Dems to force vote on creating new customs union with EU The Liberal Democrats are forcing a vote in parliament on creating a new customs union to put pressure on Labour MPs to take a more pro-EU stance. Ed Davey’s party is writing to all Labour MPs urging them to back a new bill in favour of a customs union with the EU, believing this is the best way to boost growth and raise". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
